conclusion: Analyze the paths each liquid takes as they travel down through the baffles.
Liquid from A starts at the top left.
Liquid from A flows down and hits the yellow baffle, moving to the right.
Liquid from A continues downward and hits the white baffle, moving more to the right.
Liquid from A eventually flows into container F.
Liquid from B starts next to A.
Liquid from B flows down and hits the same yellow baffle, moving to the right.
Liquid from B follows a similar path to the liquid from A and combines into container F.
Liquid from C starts at the center top.
Liquid from C flows down and hits the orange baffle, moving slightly left.
Liquid from C hits the white baffle and moves downward, flowing into container F.
Liquid from D starts at the top right.
Liquid from D flows down directly into container F without significant deflection.
All the liquids flow into container F.
The liquid flows into container F.
